column1: Table LA4:  Offending by children who have been looked after continuously for at least 12 months1

column2: Number of children looked after at 31 March who had been looked after for at least 12 months2
column4: Number of looked after children aged 10 or older at 31 March3
column6: Looked after children aged 10 and above
Number convicted or subject to a final warning or reprimand during the year4
column7: Percentage convicted or subject to a final warning or reprimand during the year

column1: 1. Offending data is collected for children aged 10 or over who have been continuously looked after for at least 12 months as at 31 March excluding those children in respite care.
2. Children of all ages who have been continuously looked after for at least 12 months
3. Children aged 10 to 17 at 31 March 2013 who have been continuously looked after for at least 12 months
4. This includes children who were convicted or subject to a final warning or reprimand under the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 during the year for an offence committed while being looked after.
All numbers relating to national or regional totals have been rounded to the nearest 10, all Local Authority numbers have been rounded to the nearest 5.
x = number less than or equal to 5 or percentage where the numerator is less than or equal to 5 or the denominator is less than or equal to 10.
See technical note 18 for more information on rounding and suppression.
